intro: Vittadinia cuneata f. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leafed vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a compact head. Vittadinia cuneata f. minor is often found in southern and western regions of Australia, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
